name: places/ChIJvUQAk_BYwokR0Kys3DvghdQ
formattedAddress: 8 E 83rd St #1a, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 8 E 83rd St #1a, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
Incredibly disappointed with my experience at Dr. Boz's office. It's difficult enough dealing with endometriosis but even more difficult when you feel as though you can't trust your medical team.

I was very happy with my initial visit to Dr. Boz's office. I loved the small stylish office and Dr. Boz's small staff (2 front facing personnel) gave a very chic boutique feel. I've never dealt with any serious medical illnesses, thank God so I knew I wanted to find a small office where I would receive a lot of care and attention. Initially, I thought this was the place for me.

Sheila (staff member) was often out of the office and apparently was the only one I could speak with regarding insurance questions. This was an issue. I was originally scheduled for surgery in August but was told that an authorization form was needed in order for my insurance to cover the hefty cost. Dr. Boz is an out of network doctor.

Dr. Boz and his staff members constantly reiterated the fact that he is an out of network doctor but if an authorization form is put in with your insurance for the procedure and approved then you will receive reinbursement once your insurance has paid the doctor. Well after the surgery was done and I paid (out of pocket) just 2 days before the surgery, I found out that an authorization was only put in for the hospital facilities and anesthesiologist and not the procedure from the doctor at all. I felt so mislead. I also did not appreciate the amount of stress I was under when finding out that I had to pay a large sum of money just 2 days before my surgery. I am a teacher and had already submitted for my time off with prepared lesson plans. I had to pay even though I thought my "approved" authorization form took care of everything. I did not like finding out that this was not the case just days before my surgery. I also did not appreciate getting a call on a Friday afternoon to get blood work and an MRI done before Monday. Even if they did need this work done closer to the date of my surgery, I would have appreciated more heads up notice so that I did not have to scramble and move things around in my schedule to make it work.  (They later found out that I didn't actually need the MRI once double checking my age). The staff was very unorganized.

I simply do not want anyone else to feel deceived.

Note: You will be asked to leave a review. My husband came with me to all of my visits (including my follow up visit post surgery). At this appointment, we were asked to leave a review. We were asked to leave a 5 star review right there in his office. He wanted to see the review before we left. We felt pressured. I made my review but apparently it did not post in a speedy manner and then my husband was asked to leave a review. It was forced.

Just wanted to make folks aware of this. I know I rely heavily on reviews before trying out a new establishment.

Dr. Boz was a great doctor - he checked in multiple times post surgery. His office (staff) needs a lot of attention on their  organization. I would have also preferred if the doctor did not discuss money with the patient (me) directly - this was weird.

originalText.text: Dr Boz is the absolute best! Not only is he an amazing surgeon but he has been supportive and thorough throughout this time for me. I came to Dr. Boz a year ago for constant pain, bloating, and overall suffering from this disease. I was told by other doctors that medications would work and it would go away with time but he looked at me and said I am going to fix you and he did just that. Dr Boz gave me my life back and I will be forever great full for him and his team. I highly recommend him to anyone suffering from this disease!

originalText.text:
“I got my life back”!!! After 30 years of suffering I am pain free! Previously having to use a mobility scooter due constant pain down my legs, I can walk normally and do stairs again. Stage 4 endometriosis excision and hysterectomy with large cysts (he saved the ovaries) and the colon, bladder, ureter and kidney involved. He untangled it all with minimally invasive robotic surgery. Dr. Boz is caring, compassionate, thorough, informative. He was my angel sent from heaven. I was blessed to have found you!
Update: 4 weeks post op, feeling great pain free!!! So thankful to have done this.  Wishing every woman in pain can see what a wonderful experience this was.

originalText.text: I found Dr. Boz after already having a laparoscopy with my gynecologist in 2020. It took a long time to figure out the reason for the numerous gastro and gyno problems I experienced. Although the first surgery lowered the intensity of my symptoms, three years later, I was still just trying to survive each day. Dr. Boz listened to everything I experienced and he was certain I still had endo. Surgery was scheduled. The entire experience with the doctor and the hospital team was phenomenal. It’s been 3 months post surgery and I can notice quite a difference and improvements with my symptoms. I would like to highlight that communication with Dr. Boz has been easy. He is present and reassuring. I hope more research, information, and treatment becomes available for endometriosis sufferers.

originalText.text:
Dr. Boz is a life changing surgeon! 3 weeks post operation I am completely pain free and healing fast. Before my pain with ovarian cyst and stage 4 endometriosis was debilitating. He has the best bedside manner and care for his patients that I’ve ever encountered in a doctor- from the consultation to surgery to post operation check ins.
Choosing Dr Boz was one of the best decisions I’ve ever made for my health and I highly recommend him for anyone suffering from endometriosis!
